box2D.dynamics.B2World

type
class
The world class manages all physics entities, dynamic simulation, and asynchronous queries.

Static Variables

e_locked : Int

e_newFixture : Int

Constructor

new(gravity : box2D.common.math.B2Vec2, doSleep : Bool)
parameters
gravity the world gravity vector.
doSleep improve performance by not simulating inactive bodies.

Instance Variables

m_bodyList : B2Body

m_contactCount : Int

m_contactList : box2D.dynamics.contacts.B2Contact

m_contactManager : B2ContactManager

m_flags : Int

m_groundBody : B2Body

Instance Methods

addController(c : box2D.dynamics.controllers.B2Controller) : box2D.dynamics.controllers.B2Controller

Add a controller to the world list

clearForces() : Void

Call this after you are done with time steps to clear the forces. You normally call this after each call to Step, unless you are performing sub-steps.

createBody(def : B2BodyDef) : B2Body

Create a rigid body given a definition. No reference to the definition is retained.

createController(controller : box2D.dynamics.controllers.B2Controller) : box2D.dynamics.controllers.B2Controller

createJoint(def : box2D.dynamics.joints.B2JointDef) : box2D.dynamics.joints.B2Joint

Create a joint to constrain bodies together. No reference to the definition is retained. This may cause the connected bodies to cease colliding.

destroyBody(b : B2Body) : Void

Destroy a rigid body given a definition. No reference to the definition is retained. This function is locked during callbacks.

destroyController(controller : box2D.dynamics.controllers.B2Controller) : Void

destroyJoint(j : box2D.dynamics.joints.B2Joint) : Void

Destroy a joint. This may cause the connected bodies to begin colliding.

drawDebugData() : Void

Call this to draw shapes and other debug draw data.

drawJoint(joint : box2D.dynamics.joints.B2Joint) : Void

drawShape(shape : box2D.collision.shapes.B2Shape, xf : box2D.common.math.B2Transform, color : box2D.common.B2Color) : Void

getBodyCount() : Int

Get the number of bodies.

getBodyList() : B2Body

returns
the head of the world body list.
Get the world body list. With the returned body, use b2Body::GetNext to get the next body in the world list. A NULL body indicates the end of the list.

getContactCount() : Int

Get the number of contacts (each may have 0 or more contact points).

getContactList() : box2D.dynamics.contacts.B2Contact

returns
the head of the world contact list.
Get the world contact list. With the returned contact, use b2Contact::GetNext to get the next contact in the world list. A NULL contact indicates the end of the list.

getGravity() : box2D.common.math.B2Vec2

Get the global gravity vector.

getGroundBody() : B2Body

The world provides a single static ground body with no collision shapes. You can use this to simplify the creation of joints and static shapes.

getJointCount() : Int

Get the number of joints.

getJointList() : box2D.dynamics.joints.B2Joint

returns
the head of the world joint list.
Get the world joint list. With the returned joint, use b2Joint::GetNext to get the next joint in the world list. A NULL joint indicates the end of the list.

getProxyCount() : Int

Get the number of broad-phase proxies.

isLocked() : Bool

Is the world locked (in the middle of a time step).

queryAABB(callbackMethod : B2Fixture -> Dynamic, aabb : box2D.collision.B2AABB) : Void

parameters
callback a user implemented callback class. It should match signature function Callback(fixture:B2Fixture):Bool Return true to continue to the next fixture.
aabb the query box.
Query the world for all fixtures that potentially overlap the provided AABB.

queryPoint(callbackMethod : B2Fixture -> Dynamic, p : box2D.common.math.B2Vec2) : Void

parameters
callback a user implemented callback class. It should match signature function Callback(fixture:B2Fixture):Bool Return true to continue to the next fixture.
Query the world for all fixtures that contain a point.

queryShape(callbackMethod : B2Fixture -> Dynamic, shape : box2D.collision.shapes.B2Shape, ?transform : box2D.common.math.B2Transform) : Void

parameters
callback a user implemented callback class. It should match signature function Callback(fixture:B2Fixture):Bool Return true to continue to the next fixture.
Query the world for all fixtures that precisely overlap the provided transformed shape.

rayCast(callbackMethod : B2Fixture -> box2D.common.math.B2Vec2 -> box2D.common.math.B2Vec2 -> Float -> Dynamic, point1 : box2D.common.math.B2Vec2, point2 : box2D.common.math.B2Vec2) : Void

parameters
callback A callback function which must be of signature: function Callback(fixture:B2Fixture, // The fixture hit by the ray point:B2Vec2, // The point of initial intersection normal:B2Vec2, // The normal vector at the point of intersection fraction:Float // The fractional length along the ray of the intersection ):Float Callback should return the new length of the ray as a fraction of the original length. By returning 0, you immediately terminate. By returning 1, you continue wiht the original ray. By returning the current fraction, you proceed to find the closest point.
point1 the ray starting point
point2 the ray ending point
Ray-cast the world for all fixtures in the path of the ray. Your callback Controls whether you get the closest point, any point, or n-points The ray-cast ignores shapes that contain the starting point

rayCastAll(point1 : box2D.common.math.B2Vec2, point2 : box2D.common.math.B2Vec2) : Array<B2Fixture>

rayCastOne(point1 : box2D.common.math.B2Vec2, point2 : box2D.common.math.B2Vec2) : B2Fixture

removeController(c : box2D.dynamics.controllers.B2Controller) : Void

setBroadPhase(broadPhase : box2D.collision.IBroadPhase) : Void

Use the given object as a broadphase. The old broadphase will not be cleanly emptied.

setContactFilter(filter : B2ContactFilter) : Void

Register a contact filter to provide specific control over collision. Otherwise the default filter is used (b2_defaultFilter).

setContactListener(listener : B2ContactListener) : Void

Register a contact event listener

setContinuousPhysics(flag : Bool) : Void

Enable/disable continuous physics. For testing.

setDebugDraw(debugDraw : B2DebugDraw) : Void

Register a routine for debug drawing. The debug draw functions are called inside the b2World::Step method, so make sure your renderer is ready to consume draw commands when you call Step().

setDestructionListener(listener : B2DestructionListener) : Void

Register a destruction listener.

setGravity(gravity : box2D.common.math.B2Vec2) : Void

Change the global gravity vector.

setWarmStarting(flag : Bool) : Void

Enable/disable warm starting. For testing.

solve(step : B2TimeStep) : Void

solveTOI(step : B2TimeStep) : Void

step(dt : Float, velocityIterations : Int, positionIterations : Int) : Void

parameters
timeStep the amount of time to simulate, this should not vary.
velocityIterations for the velocity constraint solver.
positionIterations for the position constraint solver.
Take a time step. This performs collision detection, integration, and constraint solution.

validate() : Void

Perform validation of internal data structures.
